EN

The cryptocurrency market is experiencing a severe downturn, having shed approximately $720 billion in total market capitalization since the beginning of 2026. The market cap has fallen to $2.29 trillion, dropping nearly 4% in the last 24 hours, as leveraged positions from the 2025 rally unwind. Bitcoin is trading near $67,880 and must hold the $65,000 level to prevent a further liquidation spiral, while investor sentiment has plummeted to "Extreme Fear." Amidst the market turbulence, Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson revealed that he has personally lost over $3 billion across various crypto cycles. Despite the significant financial hit, Hoskinson stated that it would have been "real easy" to cash out but reaffirmed his commitment to long-term blockchain development. Analysts suggest that a stabilization in Bitcoin prices and reduced liquidation volumes are necessary signs for a potential market recovery.

  • Crypto market cap fell by roughly $720 billion since Jan 1, 2026, dropping to $2.29 trillion.
  • Bitcoin needs to hold above $65,000 to stop the liquidation spiral as sentiment hits "Extreme Fear".
